trans-unit.source: Defines a metadata attribute that you can use when developing ASP.NET server controls.
Use the ParseChildrenAttribute class to indicate how the page parser should treat content nested inside a server control tag declared on a page.
This class cannot be inherited.
The ParseChildrenAttribute class allows you to specify parsing logic for a custom server control by marking the server control with the ParseChildrenAttribute metadata attribute.
Marking your server control with the metadata attribute `ParseChildren(true)` instructs the parser to interpret the elements that are contained within the server control's tags as properties.
In this scenario, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ChildrenAsProperties%2A> property is `true`.

Marking your server control with the metadata attribute `ParseChildren(true,"<Default Property>")` sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.DefaultProperty%2A> property to the name of the property that is passed into the attribute.

Marking your server control with the metadata attribute `ParseChildren(false)`, the default value, instructs the parser to interpret the elements that are contained within the server control's tags as content that will be parsed with an associated <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder> that is, as controls.
In this scenario, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ChildrenAsProperties%2A> property is `false`.
For information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> class.
A new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> class is created with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ChildrenAsProperties%2A> property set to `false`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> class using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ChildrenAsProperties*> property to determine if the elements that are contained within a server control are parsed as properties of the server control.
If `childrenAsProperties` is `false`, the elements that are contained within the server control are parsed as a control.
`false` is the default for <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to parse the elements as properties of the server control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> class using the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ChildControlType*> property to determine which elements that are contained within a server control are parsed as controls.
The control type to parse as a property.
childControlType is .
Initializes a new instance of the class using the childrenAsProperties and defaultProperty parameters.
If `childrenAsProperties` is `false`, the elements are parsed as controls.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to parse the elements as properties of the server control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A string that defines a collection property of the server control into which nested content is parsed by default.
Gets a value indicating the allowed type of a control.
If the allowed control type is `null`, meaning that it has not been specified, the default type, which is a <xref:System.Web.UI.Control?displayProperty=fullName> control, is returned.
The control type.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to parse the elements that are contained within a server control as properties.
If the ChildrenAsProperties property is set to `false`, the elements that are contained within a server control are parsed as a control.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to parse the elements as properties; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
The current was invoked with childrenAsProperties set to .
Defines the default value for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> class.
This field is read-only.
The default value for the Default field is `false`, which means that elements are not parsed as properties of the server control.
To be added.
Gets or sets the default property for the server control into which the elements are parsed.
The DefaultProperty property is used only if a string is passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> constructor.
When the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> class is created, the DefaultProperty property defines the default property for the server control that is being parsed.
The name of the default collection property of the server control into which the elements are parsed.
The current was invoked with childrenAsProperties set to .
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
The object to compare with the current object.
if obj is equal to the current object; otherwise, .
Serves as a hash function for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> object.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> object.
Returns a value indicating whether the value of the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> class is the default value of the derived class.
The default value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute> class is the <xref:System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute.ParseAsChildren> field.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.ParseChildrenAttribute"></xref> value is the default instance; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Indicates that the nested content that is contained within the server control is parsed as controls.
If the ParseAsChildren field is called, the nested content that are contained within the server control are not parsed as properties; rather, they are parsed as a control.
To be added.
Indicates that the nested content that is contained within a server control is parsed as properties of the control.
If the ParseAsProperties field is called, the nested content contained within a server control is parsed as properties.
To be added.
